content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Plutôt originale !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: And while not really required, it would be nice to mention that the notes are only from the F-Major scale for clarity's sake (unless I'm wrong about which scale it is).

To fix the issue of ambiguity about trailing spaces, you can require every row to start and end with a pipe: |
Or to end with two pipes like the end of a song.

Great idea +1

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: this is great idea.

This one may be difficult to do in reverse mode if no prior music knowledge. Sure, it can be figured out but the fact that music notes go back to "A" after "G" may be confusing for some. A person who does know how to read music will have an advantage for sure.

Otherwise I love the concept!

1- This sentence is not clear(I have no pre-knowledge about piano or music notes):
>>>Note: Each music note has 1 possible location for the purposes of this puzzle.

2- The output lines have different lengths. For me, that wasn't clear and had to select text to differentiate between a space and a return to line. Would be more straight forward if all output lines are of length n.
I found this puzzle which is the inversion of this, but very similar otherwise. https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/536225bfaecbb8fd531db7252b7c275ccff0

1 - The music staff is cyclical, it repeats, ABCDEFG -> ABCDEFG over and over. I suppose that without having seen sheet music before that that would be a concerning statement, I'll figure out how to fix it.

2 - I was between on this but I felt like not including whitespaces was consistent with other puzzles, I think that it does make it too difficult but I'm not sure if that'd be a faux pas or not.

Thats a fair point. I added another very basic test case which is "ABCDEFG". I don't think there is any way of avoiding this kind of advantage as it would probably come into play for fastest to some extent as well... Let me know if you think it should be only fastest or if that change could be enough to make it OK. Thanks for the feedback!
I don’t want to confuse people, but I might add “there are no sharps or flats”, the trailing || is a good idea

I think that the first 2 test cases should clue the player in a bit better. Like make the first one "ABCDEFG" and the very next either "FGABCDE" or "GFEDCBA".

Realistically, not every reverse mode clash starts everyone off on level playing ground. As an example:

Input: 4   Output: 24
Input: 5   Output: 120

This would be near impossible if someone didn't know factorial. Granted, math is more commonly known among coders than music lol.

I think if you adjust the first couple of test cases it should be fine.
i agree that the standard ABCDEFG should be first probably. Good idea.
